meanings.sent1: I made some quick approximations to figure out the total cost.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often use approximations when they don't have exact measurements.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's approximation of the number of candies in the jar was way off!
meanings.sent4: Her guess was an approximation, but it turned out to be surprisingly accurate.
meanings.sent5: The detective's approximation of the suspect's height helped solve the case.

meanings.definition: The act of estimating or calculating something.
meanings.sent1: The approximation of the distance to the moon was challenging for the students.
meanings.sent2: Mathematicians rely on approximations to simplify complex problems.
meanings.sent3: The approximation of the time it took to bake the cake was way off!
meanings.sent4: Her quick approximation of the answer saved her time during the test.
meanings.sent5: The approximation of the population growth was crucial for urban planning.
